subs.text: @GrabowskiDylan Yeah, took me out for most of Feb. Got over the worst of it in a few days, but then was easily exhausted for weeks
subs.rawText: @GrabowskiDylan Yeah, took me out for most of Feb. Got over the worst of it in a few days, but then was easily exhausted for weeks

subs.text: Finally got back to the gym this week after nearly 3 months. Holidays, omicron wave, getting covid anyway despite precautions and trip east have kept me away too long. I'm sore, but that will pass soon enough. [link]
subs.rawText: Finally got back to the gym this week after nearly 3 months. Holidays, omicron wave, getting covid anyway despite precautions and trip east have kept me away too long. I'm sore, but that will pass soon enough. https://t.co/s0UFFh44cc

subs.text: March 7

Like last time, I'll be spending a lot of my time during the Neo Polaris Launchpad Hackathon ([link]) helping participants and answering questions about @Neo_Blockchain development and the Neo Blockchain Toolkit. https://t.co/wvGWX7OclY
subs.rawText: Like last time, I'll be spending a lot of my time during the Neo Polaris Launchpad Hackathon (https://t.co/nsdj4fXH09) helping participants and answering questions about @Neo_Blockchain development and the Neo Blockchain Toolkit. https://t.co/wvGWX7OclY

subs.text: I love events like this. The direct line to the folks using the tools under the pressure of competition is invaluable. Feedback we got last time led directly to product improvements that benefit the entire community.
subs.rawText: I love events like this. The direct line to the folks using the tools under the pressure of competition is invaluable. Feedback we got last time led directly to product improvements that benefit the entire community.

subs.text: There are significant debugger improvements that will be available (in preview) this week. Neo C# tooling updates to support these debugger improvements will be available later this month - just in time for the start of the hackathon in April! [link]
subs.rawText:
There are significant debugger improvements that will be available (in preview) this week. Neo C# tooling updates to support these debugger improvements will be available later this month - just in time for the start of the hackathon in April!
 
https://t.co/ZOyqOQYiyJ

subs.text: If you're participating in Neo Polaris Launchpad, please don't hesitate to reach out to me with questions. The best way to reach me is via the official @Neo_Blockchain Discord ([link]), though you can obviously also reach me here on Twitter as well. Good Luck!
subs.rawText:
If you're participating in Neo Polaris Launchpad, please don't hesitate to reach out to me with questions.

The best way to reach me is via the official @Neo_Blockchain Discord (https://t.co/wkxYs9CCV9), though you can obviously also reach me here on Twitter as well.

Good Luck!

subs.text: March 5

Would have liked to see a @SeattleKraken win, but the @Capitals need the standings points more.

My eldest said tonight was like the opposite of watching say a Penguins /Flyers game. Those games, we're usually rooting for a meteor to hit the arena.
subs.rawText:
Would have liked to see a @SeattleKraken win, but the @Capitals need the standings points more.

My eldest said tonight was like the opposite of watching say a Penguins /Flyers game. Those games, we're usually rooting for a meteor to hit the arena.

subs.text: Love to see @Capitals saluting @SeattleKraken captain Mark Giordano in his 1000th game
subs.rawText: Love to see @Capitals saluting @SeattleKraken captain Mark Giordano in his 1000th game

subs.text: My wife and parents conspired to bring me back east to catch @SeattleKraken v. @Capitals. I've been a Caps fan since I was a kid. And of course I support the Kraken - my home team. So its awesome to get the chance to see these two teams face off. [link]
subs.rawText:
My wife and parents conspired to bring me back east to catch @SeattleKraken v. @Capitals.

I've been a Caps fan since I was a kid. And of course I support the Kraken - my home team. So its awesome to get the chance to see these two teams face off. https://t.co/foLDc9WuM9

subs.text: I figured there would be of plenty of folks in Caps jerseys, so I wore my Kraken jersey. Way out numbered, but I've seen more Seattle jerseys than I was expecting
subs.rawText: I figured there would be of plenty of folks in Caps jerseys, so I wore my Kraken jersey. Way out numbered, but I've seen more Seattle jerseys than I was expecting

subs.text: March 1

@clairernovotny Not really, though the primitives are there obviously.

I'm looking for stuff like path comparison (case insensitive on windows vs case sensitive elsewhere) & processing paths that may come from another platform (processing a unix path via Path.Combine on Windows or vis-versa)
subs.rawText:
@clairernovotny Not really, though the primitives are there obviously.

I'm looking for stuff like path comparison (case insensitive on windows vs case sensitive elsewhere) & processing paths that may come from another platform (processing a unix path via Path.Combine on Windows or vis-versa)

subs.text:
Is there a xplat .NET library for working with file system paths that I'm not aware of?

I could roll my own, but I'd rather use an existing (i.e. tested) library. I've done enough file system work to know there be dragons in the edge cases.
subs.rawText:
Is there a xplat .NET library for working with file system paths that I'm not aware of?

I could roll my own, but I'd rather use an existing (i.e. tested) library. I've done enough file system work to know there be dragons in the edge cases.
